alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 12:17PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible over the next several days. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Utah, including the following county, Uintah. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Anglers and anyone near or in the Green River should use extreme caution and be on the lookout for ice and debris flowing in the river. Move away from the river and seek higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1213 PM MST, Emergency management reported an ice jam within the advisory area near Jensen. Minor flooding may begin at any time over the next several days. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Uintah County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Emergency management and law enforcement are asking all citizens to use extreme caution in and around the Green River southeast of Jensen.
